intro: Swainsona phacifolia, commonly known as the yellow false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open habitats. Swainsona phacifolia is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally by indigenous communities.
